Posts.EditableText:
Hi ALex,
I added some text to the wiki and I want to append a zip with a gamefile, but only pics are allowed to append. What can I do?
Posts.HTML:
Hi ALex,
I added some text to the wiki and I want to append a zip with a gamefile, but only pics are allowed to append. What can I do?

Posts.EditableText: I can probably enable this in the MediaWiki config, but why do you need it? I'd be much happier with simple code samples - they will be much easier to maintain.
Posts.HTML: I can probably enable this in the MediaWiki config, but why do you need it? I'd be much happier with simple code samples - they will be much easier to maintain.

Posts.EditableText: I want to append the complete gamefile. It's the source of my introduction-example. My reason for posting it is that it is easier to use than a code sample. Just download it, test it and learn from it. I learnt most about Q5 from your internal testfiles, not from the wiki. To descripe it that deeply that a beginner could understand it I must add screenshots. If there a changes in the system (getinput will change in the future) I (or anyone else) must change them. This is much more work than changing the gamefile where the user can see "livescreenshots" This nice code-tag of the forum isn't available in the wiki?
Posts.HTML:
I want to append the complete gamefile. It's the source of my introduction-example. My reason for posting it is that it is easier to use than a code sample. Just download it, test it and learn from it. I learnt most about Q5 from your internal testfiles, not from the wiki.

To descripe it that deeply that a beginner could understand it I must add screenshots. If there a changes in the system (getinput will change in the future) I (or anyone else) must change them. This is much more work than changing the gamefile where the user can see "livescreenshots"

This nice code-tag of the forum isn't available in the wiki?

Posts.EditableText: OK I have added "aslx" as a permitted extension. You can get code formatting on the wiki by using a space before a line. See the "XML File Format" section on http://quest5.net/wiki/ASLX_Elements
Posts.HTML:
OK I have added "aslx" as a permitted extension.

You can get code formatting on the wiki by using a space before a line. See the "XML File Format" section on http://quest5.net/wiki/ASLX_Elements

See the "XML File Format" section on http://quest5.net/wiki/ASLX_Elements[/quote:2ol5f7jp] yes, but the code-tag displays a box with 5 lines of code and if you want to see more lines you have to scroll
